I'm glad to meet new people no matter the reason: visiting your organisation, joining a meetup or discuss web development. Leave me a message or ping me on any social network.

Appreciation Day

13 Mar 2014

Last Thursday I was approached by two guys at local startup gathering to discuss what a value of Kudobox as a practice and a value of online Kudobox particularly is. There were a lot to say but one of the best stories I could tell them appeared the next day. And it was ACA IT-Solutions which related it…

Appreciation Day is a nice practice of devoting a whole day to saying and sending appreciations and thank you messages to your colleagues. According to Jurgen Appelo, Kudo Cards are a great tool to use that time because kudos are small public rewards provided by peers i.e. people who know much better how you do your job than your managers.

Kudobox brings physical kudo cards to a new level, allowing to share your appreciation instantly on Twitter and let the whole world know how cool your colleagues are.

What did smart guys from ACA IT-Solutions do?

They used Kudobox to send appreciations to each other through Twitter saying 'You rock! Thanks a lot for helping me with...'

My #kudo to all my colleagues @aca_it :D via http://t.co/Wbt0aark3b pic.twitter.com/PDvd3NNYac

— Tom Metten (@tmetten) March 7, 2014

My #kudo to @KoenOlaerts for being my ultimate Java & Liferay Hero ;) @aca_it via http://t.co/nE9aMWNmgq pic.twitter.com/OQN3Ob5xLN

— Do Rien (@dorien_jorissen) March 7, 2014

My #kodus to the great team @aca_it. http://t.co/njHd7oDwE0 #appreciationday #almostover #repeatwhiletrue

— Stijn Van den Enden (@stieno) March 7, 2014

The kudos started multiple discussions and helped many employees at ACA IT-Solutions to recall funny or challenging moments of their collaboration.

I don't know how they feel but for me getting a kudo is like remembering a good story while drinking beer in a cozy pub. Image it and whoala... an appreciation day becomes an awesome beer party full of jokes and good stories.

What a great time! What a nice idea!

Should you wait for another #appreciation day?

Of course not!

The more you wait for saying ‘thank you’, the more chances your colleagues will help you with something else and you’ll get another reason to be thankful for.

Do not wait for a year, a month or even a day.

Send your appreciation now!
